ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: And as for poets, it is the misled who follow them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: As for the poets, only those who go astray follow them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: As for poets, only the wayward follow them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Only the erring people follow the poets.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And the astray follow the poets.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: As for the poets, the astray follow them,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And as to the poets, those who go astray follow them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And the poets -- the perverse follow them;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: As for poets, the erring follow them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: And as for the poets -- it is the misled who follow them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: As for the poets -it is the seduced who follow them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: As for the poets, [only] the perverse follow them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And the Poets,- It is those straying in Evil, who follow them:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: As for the poets, the erring follow them,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Poets are followed by the perverse.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And as for the poets—the deviators follow them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And the poets - [only] the deviators follow them;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [26:224] As for the poets, [only] the perverse follow them, in their poetry, propounding it and reciting it on their behalf to others; they are thus reprehensible.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (As for poets) 'Abdullah Ibn al-Zib'ari and his host who composed poetry, (the erring follow them) those who transmit poetry relate it from them.
